report.title: Record counts for my sites map using standard filter params
report.description: Lists locations with mappable boundary output and the number of records within them.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM locations l1 JOIN ( SELECT l.id, count(distinct o.id) as count FROM locations l JOIN locations_websites lw on lw.location_id=l.id and lw.deleted=false and lw.website_id in (#website_ids#) LEFT JOIN person_attribute_values pav ON pav.person_attribute_id=#person_site_attr_id# AND pav.int_value=l.id AND pav.deleted=false LEFT JOIN users u on u.person_id=pav.person_id AND u.id=#user_id# LEFT JOIN (cache_occurrences_functional o #agreements_join# #joins# AND #sharing_filter# AND o.zero_abundance='f' #filters# #idlist# ) ON st_intersects(o.public_geom, coalesce(l.boundary_geom, l.centroid_geom)) AND NOT st_touches(o.public_geom, coalesce(l.boundary_geom, l.centroid_geom)) WHERE l.deleted=false AND ('#location_type_ids#'='0' OR l.location_type_id IN (#location_type_ids#)) AND (l.created_by_id=#user_id# or u.id=#user_id#) GROUP BY l.id, l.name ) as l2 ON l2.id=l1.id

param.name: location_type_ids
param.description: Comma separated list of location_type_ids to allow for inclusion in the results.

param.name: person_site_attr_id
param.description: The person attribute ID used to store My Sites

column.name: fs
column.sql: case when count>1000 then 8 else 9 end
